categoryInfo.title: Academics
categoryInfo.guideInfo: Our School of Liberal Arts comprises of more than 40 major, minor and certificate programs, including degrees in Visual Arts, Political Science, Psychology and Education. Students across majors receive interdisciplinary offerings that teach project leadership, ethical problem-solving and synthesizing multiple perspectives.
categoryInfo.buttonText: How we prepare students for lifelong learning

categoryInfo.title: Academics
categoryInfo.guideInfo: If you’re interested in Accounting, Economics, Finance, Management or Marketing, the School of Business is for you. In fact, if you can’t pick just one, that’s OK – business majors also have the option of combining concentrations in two disciplines to create a unique degree tailored to their goals.
categoryInfo.buttonText: Leading in business and in life

categoryInfo.title: Academics
categoryInfo.guideInfo: The College of Science equips students in Computer Science, Physics and Astronomy, Mathematics, Nursing and more to lead the way with innovative research in fields such as artificial intelligence, robotics and science education. Did we mention much of this research is funded by the National Science Foundation and NASA?
categoryInfo.buttonText: Discover our hands-on approach to science.

categoryInfo.title: Academics
categoryInfo.guideInfo: More than half of our freshmen start at Siena as exploring students, which means they get to take classes across disciplines and are paired with a special faculty advisor to guide them. And they can still graduate within four years!

categoryInfo.title: Academics
categoryInfo.guideInfo: Every Siena student takes 14 liberal arts-based courses that are designed to prepare them for professional success and to help develop essential skills, such as critical thinking and effective communication.

categoryInfo.title: Student Life
categoryInfo.guideInfo: If you have a passion for it, we have a club for it – really, there are more than 120 clubs and organizations at Siena, with more added each year. Find your niche and make new friends in orgs like Quidditch Club, Chaotick (our hip-hop dance club), Lost in Sound (for music lovers), Her Campus magazine and many, many more!

categoryInfo.title: Student Life
categoryInfo.guideInfo: We know how to have fun at Siena. From annual events such as Hip-Hop Week and SienaFest (our yearend celebration!) to regular weekend activities like trivia and open mic nights, there’s always something exciting happening.

categoryInfo.title: Student Life
categoryInfo.guideInfo: Reflecting our roots in the Franciscan tradition, service is one of Siena’s greatest values. We offer opportunities to give back to the local community as well as chances to embark on service trips across the globe.

categoryInfo.title: Student Life
categoryInfo.guideInfo: We provide students with a variety of ways to see the world – Saints can travel to more than 55 countries around the globe through short- and long-term study abroad programs, no matter their majors.
categoryInfo.buttonText: Discover all the places you could go!

categoryInfo.title: Student Life
categoryInfo.guideInfo: PRIDE-GSA at Siena works to foster a safe atmosphere for queer students by engaging with the community and promoting acceptance. The org hosts annual events to raise awareness, and in March 2019 hosted the 24th annual Northeast LGBT conference!

categoryInfo.title: Financial Assistance
categoryInfo.headerInterest: FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid)
categoryInfo.guideHeader: FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid)
categoryInfo.guideInfo: As a high school student, you’ve probably heard a lot about how important the FAFSA is! That’s because you’ll need to file it to be considered for federal awards, such as loans, grants and scholarships. Many colleges – including Siena – also use the FAFSA to determine eligibility for school-specific funding.

categoryInfo.title: Financial Assistance
categoryInfo.guideInfo: We’ll cut to the chase: Every applicant who is admitted to Siena and submits the FAFSA will receive at least $52,000 in scholarships. No other criteria. And because we believe in our students, we guarantee that you will graduate within four years or your degree is on us.

categoryInfo.title: Financial Assistance
categoryInfo.guideInfo: Here at Siena, we do the most. No, really – The New York Times named us one of the Top Colleges Doing the Most for the American Dream. We’ve also been recognized by Forbes as a Best Value College, and MONEY included Siena in the Best Colleges for Your Money.
categoryInfo.buttonText: An investment in the education for a lifetime

categoryInfo.title: Resources
categoryInfo.guideInfo: The Academic Affairs Office is here to support students as they work toward their degrees. We offer academic advising, a writing center, student tutoring and more to help you stay on the path to success.
categoryInfo.buttonText: How can I best take advantage of these resources?

categoryInfo.title: Resources
categoryInfo.guideInfo: The faculty at our Financial Aid Office are eager to help connect students and their families with valuable resources to help make college more affordable – reach out with any questions!
categoryInfo.buttonText: How we make college as accessible as possible

categoryInfo.title: Resources
categoryInfo.guideInfo: We’re here to guide students as they pursue their goals, no matter what they are! Here, Saints can meet with a Career Counselor to discuss their interests, find careers that match their passions, choose a major, build a resume and conduct mock interviews.
categoryInfo.buttonText: Learn about the Four Phases of Career Development!

categoryInfo.title: Student Success
categoryInfo.guideInfo: Siena students participate in more than 400 internships each year at more than 300 different companies and organizations. They’ve interned at Target, Northwestern Mutual, NASA and even Google, to name a few. Plus, our Career Center helps Saints prepare for careers with mock interviews and resume workshops.

categoryInfo.title: Student Success
categoryInfo.guideInfo: Our friendly and supportive alumni community (more than 35,000 strong!) spans the globe. Thirty percent of recent alumni say that a Siena connection led to their first or current job.
categoryInfo.buttonText: Once a Saint, always a Saint

categoryInfo.title: Student Success
categoryInfo.guideInfo: Frank Chietro ’17 is the Associate Systems Engineer at Disney/Pixar. He says of his first days here, “[Siena] immediately feels like home when you step onto campus. It’s everything you want college to be. You could just tell you could build friends and relations.” And Siena’s reputation can help our graduates make a great first impression. Chietra says, “One of the reasons Disney hired me was because they saw…I went to Siena.”

categoryInfo.title: Student Success
categoryInfo.guideInfo: After graduation, Siena Saints have found jobs crafting marketing for Proctors, programming for the New York State Senate and developing software for Amazon. Plus, 86% of Siena grads attest that their job allows them to make a positive contribution to society.

questionSets.title: Academics
questionSets.guideHeader: ACADEMICS: Look for a strong foundation.
questionSets.guideInfo: Get to know academics at Siena!
questionSets.categoryFormHeadline: What would you like to learn more about?
questionSets.introCopy: When considering your college options, remember that a school that offers a wide range of majors as well as a strong core curriculum will help you build a foundation for success across fields of study. For example, at Siena, we offer more than 36 majors and more than 80 minors. All our students benefit from a liberal arts education that equips them to excel in any profession, so they may pursue their passions with confidence.

questionSets.title: Student Life
questionSets.guideHeader: STUDENT LIFE: Explore outside the classroom.
questionSets.guideInfo: Learn how about all the ways you can get involved here.
questionSets.categoryFormHeadline: Select the options you’d like more information on:
questionSets.introCopy: Your college experience is about more than what you learn in the classroom – that’s why it’s called an experience! Be sure to keep an eye out for a school with plenty of student life options to explore your interests and maybe even discover a new passion. This exploration could shape your future, and it’s a fun way to get to know other students. Siena is home to more than 120 clubs and organizations, and our diverse student community is rich with opportunity to get involved.

questionSets.title: Financial Assistance
questionSets.guideHeader: FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE: Make your education accessible.
questionSets.guideInfo: Get to know our commitment to affordability.
questionSets.categoryFormHeadline: What would you like more information on?
questionSets.question1: FAFSA (Free Application for Federal Student Aid)
questionSets.introCopy: “Value” can mean different things to different people, from low cost of tuition to availability of scholarships to the level of personal attention you’ll receive from professors in the classroom. As you figure out everything that value means to you, be sure to take advantage of financial aid resources such as the FAFSA and net price calculators, and reach out to schools’ financial aid offices to learn about school-specific scholarship options.

questionSets.title: Resources
questionSets.guideInfo: Discover our array of student resources.
questionSets.categoryFormHeadline: Let us know which you would like to know more about:
questionSets.introCopy: One thing to keep an eye out for on your college search is a network of supportive services. If a school has plenty of resources, that’s a good sign that they’re invested in your success. Talking to admissions counselors is a great way to learn about what resources a college offers. At Siena, we know the value of supporting our students as they pursue the path to achieving their dreams. We’re here to help you get there.

questionSets.title: Student Success
questionSets.guideInfo: Find out how Siena is invested in your success.
questionSets.categoryFormHeadline: Choose the topics you would like to know more about:
questionSets.introCopy: College is an integral step in shaping your future, so your ideal college will be one that continues to help you succeed beyond the day that you receive your diploma. Identify schools with strong, supportive alumni networks that will help you make connections. Also seek colleges with plenty of opportunities for resume-building, such as internships and research projects. At Siena, our motto is “an education for a lifetime,” because we truly believe in preparing students for success in all facets of their lives.

ThanksCopy.thanksMessage:
Almost Done!
Take a moment to review your selections. If there is anything else you’d like to include, you may go back to add it now.
ThanksCopy.guideIntro:
Welcome to your guide!
This is your personal resource for college exploration--customized by you, for you. We're certain this will be an excellent addition to your toolkit as you search for your ideal school.
